name: Predictable Password Reset Token
lay_explain: The reset link uses a guessable code, so attackers can take over accounts.
why_it_matters: Compromises any user with an outstanding reset.

name: Credential Stuffing
lay_explain: Attackers try leaked email/password pairs from other sites to log in.
why_it_matters: Many users reuse passwords; easy large-scale compromise.

name: No Rate Limiting on Reset
lay_explain: Reset flows allow unlimited attempts so tokens and emails can be brute forced.
why_it_matters: Enables guessing and automation at scale.

name: Negative Pricing / Quantity Logic Abuse
lay_explain: Tricks the cart math to produce negative totals or free items.
why_it_matters: Leads to fraud and revenue loss.

name: Firmware Update Interception
lay_explain: Intercepts the device update to install a malicious firmware.
why_it_matters: Gives persistent control of the device.

name: Default Credentials
lay_explain: Device ships with a default password that users may not change.

name: credential stuffing
description: Try email/password pairs leaked from other sites to log in.
why: People often reuse passwords across services.
comms: Using previously leaked email/password combinations to log in because users reuse passwords.

name: password spraying
description: Try a few common passwords across many accounts to avoid lockout.
comms: Trying a small set of common passwords across many users to dodge lockouts.

name: phishing for credentials
description: Trick the user into entering their password or code on a fake site.
comms: Tricking someone with a convincing message or page to reveal their password.

name: shoulder surfing password
description: Observe the user typing a password on a shared device.
comms: Watching someone type their password on a keyboard or screen.

name: password reset flow
description: Use the ‘Forgot password’ feature to reset access.

name: intercept reset email
description: Access the victim’s email or device to click the reset link.
comms: If you can open the victim’s mailbox or a device where they’re logged in, you can complete the reset.

name: weak/reused email password
description: Log into the victim’s email using reused or weak creds.

name: shared device still logged in
description: Use a device where the account is already logged in to access links or content.

name: lockout/rate limit bypass
description: Space out attempts or rotate IPs to avoid triggering lockout.

name: use stolen account with saved card
description: Take over an account that has a saved card and place an order.

name: use leaked card details
description: Use leaked/stolen card details to pay for goods.

name: stack discounts/referrals
description: Combine multiple discounts beyond what’s intended.

name: abuse free shipping threshold
description: Manipulate basket to qualify for free shipping while abusing promos.

name: ship to accessible pickup point
description: Use a pickup point that the fraudster can access.

name: item-not-received refund abuse
description: Claim a refund while still collecting the parcel.

name: join home wi-fi
description: Connect to the home network to reach the device locally.

name: access local interface/rtsp
description: Use the camera’s local interface or RTSP stream on the LAN.

name: default admin password
description: Device admin panel left on factory credentials.

name: default stream key
description: Streaming key not changed from default.

name: phishing for the link
description: Trick the owner into sharing the document link.

name: social engineering for sharing
description: Persuade someone to share the link directly.

name: predictable link pattern + enumeration
description: Learn naming/path patterns and try likely URLs.

name: find exposed links in public repos/search
description: Search code, tickets, or the web for links left public.

name: use shared device/browser history
description: Open the document from a device where the link was already used.
